p: The daily rates of ED visits for RTIs and COPD were substantially seasonal with highest rates in the winter [10.7 per 10 5 (95% C.I. 10.55–10.87) and 1.84 per 10 5 (1.81–1.87) respectively, Fig 6] and lowest in the summer [5.72 per 10 5 (5.66–5.79) and 0.59 per 10 5 (0.58–0.60), respectively]. The rates in the other seasons are also shown in Fig 6. The daily rates for ED visits and hospitalizations for asthma were highest in the fall [1.39 per 10 5 (1.37–1.72), and 0.15 per 10 5 (0.146–0.154), respectively] and the lowest in the summer (1.05 per 10 5 (1.03–1.08), and 0.095 per 10 5 (0.091–0.096) respectively].
